description: The Payment Provider service plugin (formerly SPI) provides functionality for integrating your site with payment providers not currently supported by Wix.
With this service plugin, you can:
* Control the way your site connects to a payment provider.
* Handle transactions processed by a payment provider.
* Handle refunds processed by a payment provider.
Learn more about using the [Payment Provider service plugin](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/wix-apps/other-apps/wix-pay/payment-provider-custom-extension).
### To add a service plugin

1. [Add the plugin to your site](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/coding-with-velo/integrations/custom-extensions-spis/custom-app-extensions-using-sp-is#step-1-create-a-new-extension-on-your-wix-site).
2. Update the [`getConfig()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/spis/wix-payments/payment-provider/getconfig) function in the **-config.js** file that is added to your site during step 1.

3. Update the [`connectAccount()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/spis/wix-payments/payment-provider/connectaccount), [`createTransaction()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/spis/wix-payments/payment-provider/createtransaction), and [`refundTransaction()`](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/spis/wix-payments/payment-provider/refundtransaction) functions in the **.js** file that is added to your site during step 1.

params.name: options
params.doc: Information to use when connecting a new payment provider account.

ret.doc: Fulfilled - Information about the created account.

docs.summary: Retrieves information for connecting a new payment provider account.
description: This function is called by Wix Payments when you try to connect a custom payment provider from your site's dashboard.
When neccessary, the code implemented in this function creates a new account on the payment provider's side. The function
returns the payment provider account information, or error information if account creation fails.
Wix uses the return values from this function when connecting the payment provider to the site.
>**Note:** This function has a second parameter called `context`. This parameter is for internal Wix use only.
>You don't need to use it in your code.
### Where to find `connectAccount()`

When you [add the Payment Provider service plugin](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/code-tutorials/wix-pay/tutorial-payment-provider-custom-extension#step-1-create-a-new-payment-provider-extension),
a folder is automatically added to your site. Use the `<my-plugin-name>.js` file in the folder to write the custom code for your payment provider.

For more information on customizing your payment provider, see [Tutorial: Payment Provider Service Plugin](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/code-tutorials/wix-pay/tutorial-payment-provider-custom-extension#my-extension-namejs).

// Custom Extensions section on your site.
//Logic for creating a new payment provider account, if needed.

//Logic for creating a new payment provider account, if needed.

params.name: options
params.doc: Information to use when creating a new transaction.

docs.summary: Retrieves information about a newly created payment provider transaction.
description: This function is called by Wix Payments when a site visitor places an order on your site.
The code implemented in this function creates a new transaction with a payment provider.
The function returns the transaction information, or error information if transaction creation fails.
Wix uses the return values from this function to add the new transaction to your site.
>**Note:** This function has a second parameter called `context`. This parameter is for internal Wix use only.
>You don't need to use it in your code.
### Where to find `createTransaction()`

When you [add the Payment Provider service plugin](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/code-tutorials/wix-pay/tutorial-payment-provider-custom-extension#step-1-create-a-new-payment-provider-extension),
a folder is automatically added to your site. Use the `<my-plugin-name>.js` file in the folder to write the custom code for your payment provider.

For more information on customizing your payment provider, see [Tutorial: Payment Provider Service Plugin](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/code-tutorials/wix-pay/tutorial-payment-provider-custom-extension#my-extension-namejs).

docs.summary: Retrieves the configuration of your payment provider plugin.
description: Set your payment provider configuration in the `return` of the `getConfig()` function. Wix calls this function when you publish your site.
Changes to the configuration don't take effect until you publish your site.
The object returned by `getConfig()` includes the information about your plugin that displays in your site's Connect, Accept Payments, and Checkout pages.
### Where to find `getConfig()`

When you [add the Payment Provider service plugin](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/code-tutorials/wix-pay/tutorial-payment-provider-custom-extension#step-1-create-a-new-payment-provider-extension),
a folder is automatically added to your site. Use the `<my-plugin-name>-config.js` file in the folder to set the default configuration for your
implementation of the custom plugin.

For more information on setting your configuration, see [Tutorial: Payment Provider Service Plugin](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/code-tutorials/wix-pay/tutorial-payment-provider-custom-extension#my-extension-name-configjs).

examples.title: Example of a configuration file
body: // Place this code in the <my-extension-name>-config.js file
// Custom Extensions section on your site.

params.name: options
params.doc: Information to use when creating a refund request.

docs.summary: Retrieves payment provider information about a newly created refund.
description: This function is called by Wix Payments when you create a refund from your site's dashboard.
The code implemented in this function sends a request to the payment provider's API to create a refund.
The function returns refund information from the payment provider, or error information if refund creation fails.
Wix uses the information returned by this function to add the refund to your site.
>**Note:** This function has a second parameter called `context`. This parameter is for internal Wix use only.
>You don't need to use it in your code.
### Where to find `refundTransaction()`

When you [add the Payment Provider service plugin](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/code-tutorials/wix-pay/tutorial-payment-provider-custom-extension#step-1-create-a-new-payment-provider-extension),
a folder is automatically added to your site. Use the `<my-plugin-name>.js` file in the folder to write the custom code for your payment provider.

For more information on customizing your payment provider, see [Tutorial: Payment Provider Service Plugin](https://dev.wix.com/docs/develop-websites/articles/code-tutorials/wix-pay/tutorial-payment-provider-custom-extension#my-extension-namejs).

examples.title: Successful refund
body: // Place this code in the <my-extension-name>.js file
// Custom Extensions section on your site.
//Logic for refunding a transaction with the payment provider.

examples.title: Failed refund
body: // Place this code in the <my-extension-name>.js file
// Custom Extensions section on your site.
//Logic for refunding a transaction with the payment provider.

members.name: taxIdentifier
members.doc: Buyer tax information. Relevant for buyers in the Brazil only.

members.name: buyerId
members.doc: Free format unique buyer identifier assigned by Wix.

members.name: label
members.doc: Label of the field to display on the dashboard.

members.name: tooltip
members.doc: Tip to display when the user hovers over the field.

members.name: svg
members.doc: URL for an svg, as a string.

members.name: png
members.doc: URL for a png, as a string.

members.name: credentials
members.doc:
Set of key-value pairs representing the credentials required to either create 
a new payment provider account or make requests to the payment provider's API using an existing account.

members.name: country
members.doc: Country for the site's business, as defined on the [Accept Payments](https://www.wix.com/my-account/site-selector/?buttonText=Set%20Up%20Payments&title=Select%20a%20Site&autoSelectOnSingleSite=true&actionUrl=https://www.wix.com/dashboard/%7b%7bmetaSiteId%7d%7d/payments/) page in the dashboard. [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) format.

members.name: currency
members.doc: Currency accepted by the site. [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) format.

members.name: credentials
members.doc:
Account credentials for making API requests to the payment provider. These 
credentials are passed to the [`createTransaction()`](#createTransaction) and [`refundTransaction()`](#refundTransaction) functions 
to use when sending requests to the provider's API.

members.name: reasonCode
members.doc: [Code](#reason-codes) indicating the reason for failure if account creation fails.

members.name: errorCode
members.doc: Error code supplied by the payment provider if account creation fails.

members.name: errorMessage
members.doc: Error message supplied by the payment provider if account creation fails.

members.name: paymentMethod
members.doc: Payment method chosen by the site visitor.

members.name: merchantCredentials
members.doc: Credentials for sending requests to the payment provider's API in key:value format.

members.name: reasonCode
members.doc: [Code](#reason-codes) indicating the outcome of the transaction request.

members.name: errorCode
members.doc: Error code supplied by the payment provider if the transaction request fails.

members.name: errorMessage
members.doc: Error message supplied by the payment provider if the transaction request fails.

members.name: redirectUrl
members.doc: URL on the payment provider's site to forward the site visitor to for payment processing.

docs.summary: Credentials to connect an account for the payment provider.

members.name: label
members.doc: Label of the field to display on the dashboard.

members.name: options
members.doc: Options to display in the dropdown field. Each option is a key-value pair.

members.name: value
members.doc: Label of the option to display on the dashboard.

members.name: remoteIp
members.doc: IP address of the site visitor who initiated the transaction.

docs.summary: URLs to the payment method's logo.

members.name: white
members.doc: URL to use for a white themed logo.

members.name: colored
members.doc: URL to use for a colorful logo.

members.name: returnUrls
members.doc: URLs to forward the site visitor to for different transaction outcomes.

members.name: totalAmount
members.doc: Total amount of the order including any extra charges expressed in the currency's smallest unit. For example, a $10.00 USD amount is expressed as `1000`.

members.name: buyerInfo
members.doc: Information about the site visitor who initiated the transaction.

docs.summary: Payment methods supported by this provider.

members.name: billingAddressMandatoryFields
members.doc:
Array of billing address fields that buyers must include in order to use this payment method.  

Options: `"ADDRESS"`, `"CITY"`, `"COUNTRY_CODE"`, `"EMAIL"`, `"FIRST_NAME"`, `"HOUSE_NUMBER"`, `"LAST_NAME"`, `"PHONE"`, `"STATE"`, `"STREET"`, `"TAX_IDENTIFIER"`, `"ZIPCODE"`

members.name: logos
members.doc:
URLs to the payment method's logo.  

These logos are displayed on the site's dashboard and the checkout cart.

members.name: title
members.doc:
**Required.** Name of the payment service provider.  

This name is displayed on your site's dashboard when selecting payment providers to connect to.

members.name: paymentMethods
members.doc:
**Required.** Payment methods supported by this provider.  

Each payment method is a key:value pair where the key is the name of the payment method. Currently, only `"hostedPage"` is supported for this key. The value of this key is an object that includes `title`, `billingAddressMandatoryFields`, and `logos`.

members.name: credentialsFields
members.doc:
**Required.** Credentials to connect an account for the payment provider.  

These fields are displayed on the **Connect** page in your site's dashboard.

members.name: merchantCredentials
members.doc: Credentials for sending requests to the payment provider's API in key-value format.

members.name: refundAmount
members.doc: Total amount to refund expressed in the currency's smallest unit. For example, a $10.00 USD amount is expressed as `1000`.

members.name: refundReason
members.doc: Enum value that indicates the reason for the refund. One of: `DUPLICATE`, `FRAUDULENT`, `REQUESTED_BY_CUSTOMER`, or `OTHER`.

members.name: reasonCode
members.doc: [Code](#reason-codes) indicating the outcome of the refund request.

members.name: errorCode
members.doc: Error code supplied by the payment provider if the refund request fails.

members.name: errorMessage
members.doc: Error message supplied by the payment provider if the refund request fails.

members.name: label
members.doc: Label of the field to display on the dashboard.

members.name: svg
members.doc: URL for an svg, as a string.

members.name: png
members.doc: URL for a png, as a string.
